intro: Linkia teretifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaf linkia, is a flowering plant native to the Pacific Islands. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its slender, elongated leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pink in color. It thrives in coastal areas and is often found in sandy or rocky soils. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
